greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of theta_3(q) * theta_4(q^4)^2 in powers of q.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of phi(q) * phi(-q^4)^2 in powers of q where phi() is a Ramanujan theta function.
Expansion of eta(q^2)^5 * (eta(q^4) / (eta(q) * eta(q^8)))^2 in powers of q.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ EllipticTheta[ 3, 0, q] EllipticTheta[ 4, 0, q^4]^2, {q, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Apr 28 2015 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x^2 + A)^5 * (eta(x^4 + A) / (eta(x + A) * eta(x^8 + A)))^2, n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Feb 18 2006
